properties.areaDesc: Union; Johnson; Pope; Hardin; Alexander; Pulaski; Massac; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; McCracken; Graves; Livingston; Marshall; Calloway; Crittenden; Lyon; Trigg; Caldwell; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 7:59AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
While overnight fog was starting to dissipate early this morning,
patches of dense fog remained, especially across portions of
southeast Missouri, western Kentucky, and far southern Illinois.
The fog will continue to burn off and should dissipate by 9 AM.
Until then, slow down, leave extra following distance, and give
yourself a little extra time to reach your destination.

NWSheadline: Patchy Dense Fog Possible Through Mid Morning

properties.areaDesc: Williamson; Saline; Gallatin; Union; Johnson; Pope; Hardin; Alexander; Pulaski; Massac; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; McCracken; Graves; Livingston; Marshall; Calloway; Crittenden; Lyon; Trigg; Caldwell; Christian; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued August 11 at 6:22AM CDT until August 11 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Visibility one quarter to one half mile in dense fog.

* WHERE...Union, Alexander, Pulaski, Johnson, Massac, Pope,
Hardin, Gallatin, Williamson and Saline County Illinois,

Butler, Wayne, Bollinger, Cape Girardeau, Scott, Stoddard, New
Madrid, and Mississippi Counties in Missouri,

Fulton, Hickman, Carlisle, Ballard, McCracken, Graves,
Livingston, Marshall, Calloway, Trigg, Lyon, Crittenden,
Caldwell and Christian Counties in Kentucky.

* WHEN...Until 8 AM CDT Friday.

* IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This includes portions of Interstate 55
in southeast Missouri, Interstate 57 in southern Illinois, and
Interstate 24 in southern Illinois and western Kentucky.
properties.instruction:
If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of
distance ahead of you.

NWSheadline: DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING

properties.areaDesc: Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued August 9 at 11:53PM CDT until August 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
The Flash Flood Watch will expire for portions of western Kentucky
and southeast Missouri, including the following areas, in western
Kentucky, Carlisle, Fulton, and Hickman. In southeast Missouri,
Butler, Carter, Mississippi, New Madrid, Ripley, Scott, Stoddard,
and Wayne MO.

The flash flooding threat for the Watch area has ended. Therefore,
the Flash Flood Watch will expire at Midnight CDT tonight.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH WILL EXPIRE AT MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT

properties.areaDesc: Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued August 9 at 8:30PM CDT until August 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be
possible.

* WHERE...Portions of western Kentucky and southeast Missouri,
including the following areas, in western Kentucky, Carlisle,
Fulton and Hickman. In southeast Missouri, Butler, Carter,
Mississippi, New Madrid, Ripley, Scott, Stoddard and Wayne MO.

* WHEN...Until Midnight CDT tonight.

* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,
creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur
in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be
flooded.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- One more round of heavy rain remains possible in the watch
area through this evening.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT

properties.areaDesc: Union; Johnson; Alexander; Pulaski; Massac; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; McCracken; Graves; Marshall; Calloway; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued August 9 at 10:52AM CDT until August 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible.

* WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois, western Kentucky and
southeast Missouri, including the following areas, in southern
Illinois, Alexander, Johnson, Massac, Pulaski and Union. In
western Kentucky, Ballard, Calloway, Carlisle, Fulton, Graves,
Hickman, Marshall and McCracken. In southeast Missouri, Bollinger,
Butler, Cape Girardeau, Carter, Mississippi, New Madrid, Ripley,
Scott, Stoddard and Wayne MO.

* WHEN...Through this evening.

* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,
creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur
in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be
flooded.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- Widespread rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches can be expected
through late tonight, with locally higher amounts possible.
Given the very saturated soils from recent rains, it will not
take much heavy rain to cause flooding to develop.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING

properties.areaDesc: Alexander, IL; Edwards, IL; Franklin, IL; Gallatin, IL; Hamilton, IL; Hardin, IL; Jackson, IL; Jefferson, IL; Johnson, IL; Massac, IL; Perry, IL; Pope, IL; Pulaski, IL; Saline, IL; Union, IL; Wabash, IL; Wayne, IL; White, IL; Williamson, IL; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN; Posey, IN; Spencer, IN; Vanderburgh, IN; Warrick, IN; Ballard, KY; Caldwell, KY; Calloway, KY; Carlisle, KY; Christian, KY; Crittenden, KY; Daviess, KY; Fulton, KY; Graves, KY; Henderson, KY; Hickman, KY; Hopkins, KY; Livingston, KY; Lyon, KY; McCracken, KY; McLean, KY; Marshall, KY; Muhlenberg, KY; Todd, KY; Trigg, KY; Union, KY; Webster, KY; Bollinger, MO; Butler, MO; Cape Girardeau, MO; Carter, MO; Mississippi, MO; New Madrid, MO; Perry, MO; Ripley, MO; Scott, MO; Stoddard, MO; Wayne, MO
properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 9 at 2:23AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
Multiple rounds of storms are forecast to commence again, both today
and tonight. These storms will offer the chance for heavy rains, and
especially if and where they repeat over the same areas,
these heavy rains may heighten localized flooding potential.

Be mindful of areas that received recent excessive rainfall amounts,
as these may be the areas most susceptible to flood when heavy rains
hit again. There could be a morning round of storms, followed by an
afternoon or evening round of storms that extends through the
overnight hours.

Stay tuned to future forecasts and updates in case a Flood Watch
becomes necessary.

properties.areaDesc: Alexander, IL; Edwards, IL; Franklin, IL; Gallatin, IL; Hamilton, IL; Hardin, IL; Jackson, IL; Jefferson, IL; Johnson, IL; Massac, IL; Perry, IL; Pope, IL; Pulaski, IL; Saline, IL; Union, IL; Wabash, IL; Wayne, IL; White, IL; Williamson, IL; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN; Posey, IN; Spencer, IN; Vanderburgh, IN; Warrick, IN; Ballard, KY; Caldwell, KY; Calloway, KY; Carlisle, KY; Christian, KY; Crittenden, KY; Daviess, KY; Fulton, KY; Graves, KY; Henderson, KY; Hickman, KY; Hopkins, KY; Livingston, KY; Lyon, KY; McCracken, KY; McLean, KY; Marshall, KY; Muhlenberg, KY; Todd, KY; Trigg, KY; Union, KY; Webster, KY; Bollinger, MO; Butler, MO; Cape Girardeau, MO; Carter, MO; Mississippi, MO; New Madrid, MO; Perry, MO; Ripley, MO; Scott, MO; Stoddard, MO; Wayne, MO
properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 8 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
Multiple rounds of storms are forecast to commence again Wednesday
and Wednesday night. The first round is forecast to occur from
midday through sunset. The second round is likely to occur mainly
from early evening through midnight. These storms will offer the
chance for heavy rains and, if and where they repeat over the
same areas, these heavy rains may heighten localized flooding
potential.

Be mindful of areas that received recent excessive rainfall amounts,
as these may be the areas most susceptible to flood when heavy rains
hit again.

Stay tuned to future forecasts and updates in case a Flood Watch
becomes necessary.

NWSheadline: Heavy Rain Coming Again Wednesday-Wednesday Night

properties.areaDesc: Jefferson; Wayne; Edwards; Wabash; Perry; Franklin; Hamilton; White; Jackson; Williamson; Saline; Gallatin; Union; Johnson; Pope; Hardin; Alexander; Pulaski; Massac; Gibson; Pike; Posey; Vanderburgh; Warrick; Spencer; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; McCracken; Graves; Livingston; Marshall; Calloway; Crittenden; Lyon; Trigg; Caldwell; Union; Webster; Hopkins; Christian; Henderson; Daviess; McLean; Muhlenberg; Todd; Perry; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Lake Wind Advisory issued August 7 at 3:19AM CDT until August 7 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...West winds around 15 mph expected.

* WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois, southwest Indiana,
western Kentucky and southeast Missouri.

* WHEN...From 10 AM CDT /11 AM EDT/ this morning to 5 PM CDT /6
PM EDT/ this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds and rough waves on area lakes will
create hazardous conditions for small craft.
properties.instruction:
Boaters on area lakes should use extra caution since strong winds
and rough waves can overturn small craft.

NWSheadline: LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM CDT /11 AM EDT/ THIS MORNING TO 5 PM CDT /6 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON

properties.areaDesc: Jackson; Williamson; Saline; Union; Johnson; Pope; Alexander; Pulaski; Massac; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; McCracken; Graves; Marshall; Calloway; Perry; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 6 at 5:41AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
Patches of dense fog are reducing visibilities to a quarter mile
or less over southeast Missouri, portions of southern Illinois,
and the Purchase Area of Kentucky. Drivers on Interstate 55
through southeast Missouri and U.S. Highway 60 from Paducah to
Poplar Bluff will be the most impacted by the poor visibility.
Drivers should slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of
visibility. Low beam headlights should be used while driving in
dense fog. Conditions should improve by 8 AM.

NWSheadline: Patchy Dense Fog Early This Morning

properties.areaDesc: Jackson; Williamson; Union; Johnson; Alexander; Pulaski; Massac; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; McCracken; Perry; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: The Heat Advisory has been cancelled.
properties.description: The Heat Advisory has been cancelled and is no longer in effect.

properties.areaDesc: Jackson; Williamson; Union; Johnson; Alexander; Pulaski; Massac; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; McCracken; Perry; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 5 at 4:03AM CDT until August 5 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heat index values up to 109 expected.

* WHERE...Portions of southern Illinois, western Kentucky and
southeast Missouri, generally to the west of a Fulton Kentucky
to Marion Illinois line.

* WHEN...From noon today to 7 PM CDT this evening.

* IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat
illnesses to occur.
properties.instruction:
Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out
of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young
children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles
under any circumstances.

Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When
possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or
evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat
stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when
possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational
Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent
rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone
overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location.
Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

NWSheadline: HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING

properties.areaDesc: Carlisle, KY; Fulton, KY; Hickman, KY; Bollinger, MO; Cape Girardeau, MO; Mississippi, MO; New Madrid, MO; Scott, MO; Stoddard, MO; Wayne, MO
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued August 4 at 12:29PM CDT until August 4 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.

* WHERE...Portions of western Kentucky and southeast Missouri,
including the following counties, in western Kentucky, Carlisle,
Fulton and Hickman. In southeast Missouri, Bollinger, Cape
Girardeau, Mississippi, New Madrid, Scott, Stoddard and Wayne.

* WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT.

* IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water
crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 1228 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the
warned area. Flooding is already occurring.
- Some locations include...
Sikeston, Dexter, Charleston, Portageville, East Prairie, New
Madrid, Chaffee, Fulton, Hickman, Bernie, Bloomfield, Marble
Hill, Clinton, Advance, Oran, Lilbourn, Miner, Benton,
Hunter-Dawson State Historic Site and Big Oak Tree State
Park.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

properties.areaDesc: Alexander; Pulaski; Fulton; Hickman; Carlisle; Ballard; Graves; Calloway; Perry; Bollinger; Cape Girardeau; Wayne; Carter; Ripley; Butler; Stoddard; Scott; Mississippi; New Madrid
properties.headline: Flood Watch issued August 4 at 11:42AM CDT until August 4 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
The Flood Watch for portions of southern Illinois, western Kentucky,
and southeast Missouri will expire at noon, as the primary near term
threat for excessive rainfall has diminished.

Due to the exceptional rainfall realized the last 24 to 48 hours,
you should be aware of any remaining flash flood, flood, and river
flood warnings in effect. Follow flood safety rules, heed road
closure signs, and never drive across a flooded roadway.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH WILL EXPIRE AT NOON CDT TODAY
